page.title: 12RELIGION/SUPERNATURAL
page.content: {Religion.}Hothfield:- Served by a fine 13th c. church of St.Margaret which has a fine Tufton family tomb % an organ on which Sir Arthur Sulivan composed 'The Lost Chord'.Westwell:- Served also by a fine 13th c.church of St.Mary.In many ways a more substantial building. The area is predominantly C of E. with R.C. & Free Churches second.{Supernatural:-}A headless ghost,dressed in 17th C. costume occasionally appeared in No.26 School Rd.Hothfield, a council house built on common frequented by highwaymen.By the Old School house in Hothfield are occasions of prodding on path in front & also inside.The sighting of an apparition in tweedy jacket on the road outside & sound of running feet on former landing, now half stair-well.
